snippet: Electronics Arts is optimistic about 2013 despite the migration of gamers to Web and mobile sites. Take-Two Interactive, an E.A. rival, reported a loss.
abstract: Electronic Arts forecasts an optimistic 30 percent growth in fiscal 2013 earnings, despite its first-quarter earnings falling 9 percent; for the three months that ended June 30, the company posts overall revenue of $491 million, compared with $524 million a year ago; net income dropped to $201 million, or 63 cents a share, compared with $221 million, or 66 cents a share a year ago; rival Take-Two Interactive Software posted a net loss of $110.8 million and a 32 percent drop in revenue in its fiscal first quarter.
lead_paragraph: Electronics Arts is optimistic about 2013 despite the migration of gamers to Web and mobile sites. Take-Two Interactive, an E.A. rival, reported a loss.

headline.seo: Electronic Arts Posts Decline in Profit
headline.main: Profit Declines at Electronic Arts, but It Forecasts Growth
headline.print_headline: Profit Declines at Electronic Arts, but It Forecasts Growth
